document.docAuthor: Cruz Da Silva, Estevam L. & Sierwald, Petra
document.masterDocTitle: On three monotypic nursery web spider genera from Madagascar with first description of the male of Tallonia picta Simon, 1889 and redescription of the type-species of Paracladycnis Blandin, 1979 and Thalassiopsis Roewer, 1955 (Araneae: Lycosoidea: Pisauridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On three monotypic nursery web spider genera from Madagascar with first description of the male of Tallonia picta Simon, 1889 and redescription of the type-species of Paracladycnis Blandin, 1979 and Thalassiopsis Roewer, 1955 (Araneae: Lycosoidea: Pisauridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Thalassiopsis Roewer 1955 a: 354
, figs. 99 b, 150 . Thalassiops (lapus); Roewer 1955 b: 144 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 14–18.
Tallonia picta Simon, 1889
. 14–16 male palpus (14 ventral, 15 detail of bulbus, 16 retrolateral), 17 superior tarsal claw of left leg IV, 18 detail of inferior tarsal claw. (C = conductor, DTP = distal tegular projection, DTA = distal tegular apophysis, E = embolus, MA = median apophysis, RTA = retrolateral tibial apophysis, ST = subtegulum, T = tegulum).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The males of
Thalassiopsis
resemble those of
Tallonia
by the long and robust distal tegular apophysis and short distal tegular projection (DTP) (
Fig. 19
), but can be distinguished by the distal tegular apophysis divided and with an acute apex ( Figs 19 ,
23, 24
), by the small protuberance (BPT) on the tegulum ( Figs 19 ,
23, 24
) and by the presence of an acute ventral tibial apophysis (VTA) ( Figs 19 , 24 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 19–22.
Thalassiopsis vachoni
Roewer
, 1955
. 19, 20 male palpus (19 ventral, 20 retrolateral). 21, 22 male habitus (21 dorsal, 22 frontal). (C = conductor, DTP = distal tegular projection, DTA = distal tegular apophysis, E = embolus, MA = median apophysis, RTA = retrolateral tibial apophysis, ST = subtegulum, T = tegulum).

FIGURES 23–26.
Thalassiopsis vachoni
Roewer
, 1955
. 23?26 male palpus (23 ventral, 24 detail of bulbus, 25 retrolateral, 26 detail of retrolateral tibial apophysis). (BPT = basal protuberance of tegulum, C = conductor, DTA = distal tegular apophysis, DTP = distal tegular projection, MA = median apophysis, RTA = retrolateral tibial apophysis, ST = subtegulum, T = tegulum, VTA = ventral tibial apophysis).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Thalassiopsis vachoni Roewer 1955 a: 354
, fig. 99 b, 150 , male holotype from Maroantsetra, Madagascar [ 1524 'S, 4944 'E] (SMF RII 10552 / 102 ) (examined).

Other material examined. MADAGASCAR , Fianarantsoa : Parc National d'Isalo, Sahanafa river [ 2218 'S, 4517 'E], elevation 500 m ,
1 ♂
,
10–13 .II. 2003
, B.L. Fisher & C.E. Griswold (CAS 9017315 ).

Note. The measurements of
T. vachoni
were made from the male holotype , but the SEM images were made from fresh individuals recently collected and deposited in CAS collection.
